content.question:
Let f and g have continuous first and second derivatives everywhere. If <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" aria-label="f of x is less than or equal to g of x">
 <semantics>
 <mrow>
 <mi>f</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>≤</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow>

 </annotation>
 </semantics>
</math>
 for all real x, which of the following must be true?

 for all real x
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" aria-label="ii. f double prime of x is less than or equal to g double prime of x">
 <semantics>
 <mrow>

 for all real x.
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" aria-label="iii. the integral from 0 to 1 of f of x with respect to x is less than or equal to the integral from 0 to 1 of g of x with respect to x">
